thread.title: Kasper Schmeichel pays tribute to Claudio Ranieri on Instagram
thread.title_full: Kasper Schmeichel pays tribute to Claudio Ranieri on Instagram

author: James
title: Kasper Schmeichel pays tribute to Claudio Ranieri on Instagram
text:
Kasper Schmeichel pays tribute to Claudio Ranieri on Instagram By James on Saturday, February 25, 2017 Schmeichel tribute 
One of the first Leicester City players to comment on the sacking of Claudio Ranieri, Kasper Schmeichel has paid tribute to the Italian coach after his sacking. Ranieri helped guide Leicester to the most unlikely title win in English football history but lost his job after becoming embroiled in a relegation battle in this campaign. 
Schmeichel wrote: “I would like to thank Claudio for everything he’s done for Leicester City Football Club, and for me personally. He deserves massive respect and huge credit for what he achieved here with us. 
“Thanks boss.” Senior player silence 
The silence of the rest of the players speaks volumes. It lends credence to the story that senior players went to the board to try to get Ranieri fired. For Schmeichel to be the first to comment after more than a day of silence is strange. 
Craig Shakespeare is the club’s caretaker boss for their game against Liverpool on Monday night. A post shared by Kasper Schmeichel (@kasperschmeichel) on Feb 24, 2017 at 12:58pm PST
